bibl.title: Amos Gustin and Catherine Gustin v. James G. Departte and Elizabeth Departte. Defendant's Answer
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the probate Court of Whitman County Washington Territory. Before WN Ruby Probate Judge
In the matter of Amos Gustin and Catherine Gustin adopting Daisy Geneva Departte minor child of James G. Departte and Elizabeth Departte
Comes now James G. Departte and Elizabeth Departte and for answer and defince is the petition of Amos Gustin and Catherin Gustin in the above entitled cause:

Allege that they have no knowledge or information sufficient to form a belief as to whether or not Amos Gustin and Catherin Gustin wherein of then are inhabitants of Washington Territory or residents of the City of Colfax Whitman County Washington Territory and therefore deny the same

Allege that they have no knowledge or information suffficient to form a belief as to whether or not said Amos Gustin and Catherine Gustin have two hundred acres of land in Nez Perce County Idaho Territory or anywhere worth three thousand dollars or any sum or that they have personal property worth two thousand dollars or any sum, or that they
or each ask leave to adopt Daisy Geneva Departte

Denys that on July 1st 1885 or at any time said Amos Gustin and Catherine Gustin or either of them requested James G. Departte and Elizabeth Departte or either of them to take said Daisy Geneva Departte in their custody and or support or maintain her.
Deny that they or either of them refused to take said child or refused to support her, or in anywise provide for her.

Deny that they then or there or at any time said child, and deny that they or either of them ever refused to pay for the support of said child. Deny that said Elizabeth Departte is partially or at all insane, or that she has at any time in the last two years been in the Insane Assylum as a patient for treatment for insanity
Deny that they or either of them are unfitt persons to have the care or custody of said minor child Daisy Geneva Departte

And for a further and separate defines defendants complain and allege
that on the 9th day of February 1885, at the birth of said Daisy Geneva Departte said Elizabeth Departte became afllicted with a disease peculiar to women and became deranged in mind and was sent to the asylum for insane in the State of Oregon for restraint That she remained there for four months the greater part of such time she stayed in and about the hotels of the City of Salem in said state of Oregon, That at the end of four months she returned to Nez Perce County Idaho right in mind, but much afflicted in body. That she with her husband in upon of benefitting her health they went to the Territory of Utah where she refuged for two years. when she returned to said Nez Perce County Idaho much benefitted in health, During this time the said Daisy Geneva Departte was left with the uncle of said Elizabeth Departte, Amos Gustin, that nothing was said when the child was put there as to how long it was to stay but it was mutually understood and agreed that the child was to remain only until such time as said Elizabeth Departte should recover her health and be able to care for and
control said chid that no money was left for the support of said child for the reason that said James G. Departte and Elizabeth Departte were poor people depending upon their labor for support and all of their accomodations were spent in caring for and curing said Elizabeth Departte of her disease aforesaid.

Defendants further allege that on the day of January 1888 said Elizabeth Departte went to the ho residence of said Amos & Catherine Gustin in the County of Nez Perce and Territory of Idaho and demanded of the return to her of the persons possession of said child, but said petitioners refused to deliver her up, that said Elizabeth Departte then went to her friends to counsult with them as to the manner of proceeding to obtain posession of said child, and while she was so consulting the petitioners removed went from the County of Nez Perce in the Territory of Idaho to the County of Whitman in the Territory of Washington, and immediately began proceedings to in this court to adopt said child
and defendants aver upon their information and belief that said petitioners named in said County of Whitman for the express purpose and no other of giving this court adopting said child Daisy Geneva Departte, and that they with intend and will shortly return to their home in the County of Nez Perce in the Territory of Idaho.
Wherefore defendants pray that the proceedings herein be dismissed
W.M. Fuman and Mark A Fullurter
